description: Antibiotics are medications specifically designed to combat bacterial infections within the body. They work by either killing the bacteria directly or inhibiting their growth and reproduction, allowing the body's immune system to eliminate the remaining pathogens.
function: Kill or inhibit the growth of bacteria on the skin

description: Azelaic acid is a naturally occurring acid found in grains like barley, wheat, and rye, and is commonly used in the treatment of acne. It works by reducing the growth of bacteria that cause acne and by keeping the pores of the skin clear.
function: Exfoliates the skin
Unclogs pores
Reduces inflammation

description: Benzoyl peroxide is available in various strengths and formulations, including gels, creams, and cleansers, allowing for flexible application based on individual skin needs.
function: Releases oxygen, which kills bacteria on the skin's surface

description: Ceramides are lipid molecules that play a crucial role in maintaining the skin's barrier and retaining moisture, which is particularly beneficial for individuals with acne.
function: Repairs and maintains the skin's barrier function

description: Corticosteroid injections are powerful medications administered directly into the skin to reduce inflammation and swelling. These injections are commonly used to treat various inflammatory skin conditions, including severe or cystic acne.
function: Suppress the immune response and reduce inflammation

description: Glycerin is a humectant that attracts moisture to the skin, making it beneficial for acne. By drawing water into the skin's outer layer, glycerin helps maintain hydration, keeping the skin balanced and healthy.
function: Draws water from the environment into the skin and helps maintain moisture balance

description: Glycolic acid is an alpha hydroxy acid (AHA) derived from sugar cane, renowned for its exfoliating properties and effectiveness in skincare.
function: Penetrates the skin to dissolve dead skin cells and unclog pores

description: Hyaluronic acid is a naturally occurring substance found in the skin that attracts and retains moisture, making it especially beneficial for those with acne.
benefits: Plumps and smooths fine lines and wrinkles
function: Attracts and holds water in the skin's dermis

description: Isotretinoin is a medication used to treat severe acne, particularly in cases that have not responded to other treatments. This powerful drug is a form of vitamin A and works by reducing the amount of oil produced by the skin's sebaceous glands.
function: Targets the underlying causes of acne

description: Lactic acid is an alpha hydroxy acid (AHA) derived from milk, known for its gentle exfoliating properties and ability to improve skin texture.
function: Promotes cell turnover and stimulates collagen production

description: Niacinamide, also known as vitamin B3, is a water-soluble vitamin that plays a crucial role in maintaining overall health. It is a form of niacin that is essential for the proper functioning of the body's cells.
function: Boosts collagen production and repairs damaged skin

description: Non-comedogenic moisturizers are formulated to not clog pores.
function: Provides hydration without blocking pores

description: Oral antibiotics are medications taken by mouth to treat bacterial infections.
function: Kill or inhibit the growth of bacteria in the body

description: Retinoids are derivatives of vitamin A that are used to treat several skin conditions.
function: Promotes skin renewal and prevents acne formation

description: Salicylic acid is a beta hydroxy acid (BHA) derived from willow bark that treats and prevents acne along with other skin conditions.
function: Penetrates into pores to dissolve oil and dead skin cells

description: Sulfur is a naturally occurring mineral with antibacterial properties against bacteria causing acne.
function: Absorbs excess oil and unclogs pores

description: Tea tree oil is an essential oil derived from the leaves of the tea tree plant that is commonly used to treat acne.
function: Kills acne-causing bacteria and reduces redness

description: Topical clindamycin is an antibiotic medication that helps control acne.
function: Inhibits bacterial growth and reduces inflammation

description: Topical retinoids are vitamin A derivatives applied to the skin to treat acne.
function: Promotes skin renewal and prevents acne formation

description: Lightweight sunscreens are sunscreen formulations that feel lightweight on the skin.
function: Blocks harmful UV rays from penetrating the skin

description: Zinc is a mineral that protects against inflammation and activates the immune system to trigger healing.
function: Acts as an antioxidant and anti-inflammatory agent
